Entities.Name: Diagnosis
Entities.Definition: Diagnosis relevant for thrombolysis decisions, such as 'ischaemic stroke' or 'haemorrhage'.

Sample Data.Sentence: CT head showed a small LHS basal ganalia ICH.

Entities.Name: Symptom
Entities.Definition: Symptoms relevant to stroke and thrombolysis treatment, like 'speech disturbance' or 'weakness'.

Sample Data.Sentence: This 70 year old lady, on warfarin for AF, was admitted with dysphasia.

Entities.Name: Social History
Entities.Definition: Social history such as smoking or alcohol use.

Sample Data.Sentence: This 70 year old lady, on warfarin for AF, was admitted with dysphasia.

Entities.Name: Treatment
Entities.Definition: Any treatments which might affect eligibility for thrombolysis.

Dataset.Name: Clinical Letters for Stroke Patients
Dataset.Details: Dataset contains 8,067 clinical letters from 2,912 patients, annotated for factors affecting thrombolysis decisions in stroke treatment.

Annotation Guidelines.Link: Supplemental materials or specific links to annotation guidelines were not mentioned directly in the document.
